display_title.display_title:
Algérie - Deuxième projet
            d’emploi rural : évaluation environnementale

docna.cdata!:
Algeria - Second Rural Employment Project :
            environmental assessment

repnme.cdata!:
Algeria - Second Rural Employment Project :
            environmental assessment

admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
subsc: General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector,Forestry,Irrigation and drainage,Crops

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Rural Employment Project is
            set in the context of a global strategy for integrated
            management, and development of marginal, and mountainous
            regions, towards a multi-sectoral program within the
            National Agricultural Development Plan. Basically, the
            project entails agricultural diversification, substituting
            crops, such as cereals, for reforestation on lands
            susceptible to erosion, through high intensive labor, which
            entails resettlement, along with infrastructure development,
            and resources mobilization. To this end, given the
            environmental, and natural resources fragility, mitigation
            measures stipulate the following. Reforestation activities
            will take place during the rainy (humid) season to prevent
            soil erosion; soils should be nurtured prior to
            reforestation - since as a result of extensive dryness, and
            livestock practices - require appropriate filter systems to
            contain water, including vegetative propagation; ensure
            rehabilitation of gutters, subject to periodic inspection,
            to prevent both potential flooding, or extreme dryness, thus
            ensuring perennials, and soil structure; ensure rational use
            of fertilizers, preferably biodegradable chemicals, taking
            into account seasonal mineral inputs, and considering
            adequate selection of resistant native plants; conduct
            periodic analysis on water quality, particularly on sewage
            waters, with provisions minimizing excavation or soil
            extraction; adequate protection of drainage systems to
            minimize surface water runoff, and, ensure appropriate
            construction designs to control soil stability.
